intro: Osmitopsis pinnatifida subsp. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved osmitopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Osmitopsis pinnatifida subsp. angustifolia is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
